bug.short_desc: RFE: make vim 8.0 do Rust syntax highlighting
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Yesterdays upgrade of vim from 7.4 to 8.0 broke rust syntax highlighting
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): vim-common-8.0.133-2.fc25.x86_64 vim-filesystem-8.0.133-2.fc25.x86_64 vim-enhanced-8.0.133-2.fc25.x86_64 vim-minimal-8.0.133-2.fc25.x86_64
original triggered here in 8.0.124, the older 7.4.1989-2 works fine for me.
Upgraded vim-common-2:7.4.1989-2.fc25.x86_64 @@commandline Upgrade 2:8.0.124-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgraded vim-enhanced-2:7.4.1989-2.fc25.x86_64 @@commandline Upgrade 2:8.0.124-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgraded vim-filesystem-2:7.4.1989-2.fc25.x86_64 @@commandline Upgrade 2:8.0.124-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgraded vim-minimal-2:7.4.1989-2.fc25.x86_64 @@commandline Upgrade 2:8.0.124-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. in a terminal open a rust source file with vim foo.rs
Actual results: Plain white text.
Expected results: Syntax highlighted text
Additional info:

Hi,
I wrote to upstream and asked about it. It seems Rust syntax highlighting was not in VIM at all and it used to be detected as filetype hercules (so it used its syntax highlighting). Now VIM can recognize both correctly, but Rust is missing its syntax file. Upstream is now trying to contact other project, which has VIM syntax file for Rust. They will ship it with base package after that.
